newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore awards deal to build armoured cars.
newsitem.headline: Singapore awards deal to build armoured cars.

text.p: Singapore said on Wednesday it has awarded a multi-million dollar contract to Singapore Technologies Automotive Ltd (STA) to build a new fleet of armoured infantry fighting vehicles for the army.

The vehicles would start rolling off production lines by September. Each vehicle is armed with machineguns, and has a top speed of 70 kph (44 mph). They will cost Singapore $2.5 million (US$1.75 million) each, STA said in a statement.
It did not say how many the government had ordered or put a precise value on the contract.

"It's a good example of what the SAF (Singapore Armed Forces)...are able to achieve in enhancing the SAF's operational capability," Defence Minister Tony Tan told state television during a tour of the company's production line.
Company officials said the armoured car may be exported to other countries in the region.
